questions.question: Which of the following has the highest content of thiamine?
questions.explanation: Gingelly (sesame) seeds have the highest content of thiamine.The thiamine content in various foods in decreasing order are as follows:•Gingelly seeds• Groundnut• Bengal gram• Whole wheat• Raw riceThiamine is lost from rice during the process of milling. As it is a water-soluble vitamin, washing,and cooking rice cause further losses. Hence, it is advisable to avoid highly polished rice and eatparboiled or under-milled rice.

questions.question: DAILYROUNDS485A patient presented with loose stools and skin rashes over the sun-exposed areas. Diet historyrevealed that the patient had been consuming a jowar-rich diet since childhood. Thiscondition results due to excess of which amino acid in the diet?
questions.explanation: This clinical scenario is suggestive of pellagra. It is caused by the excess of leucine in jowar.Excess of leucine in jowar (sorghum) and maize interferes with the conversion of tryptophan toniacin causing pellagra. It presents with the following features:• Diarrhea• Dermatitis (sun-exposed areas)490• DementiaPeople consuming jowar also have a higher risk of developing genu valgum and osteoporosis dueto greater retention of ingested fluoride.

questions.question: What is the recommended daily allowance of vitamin A for a 9-month old baby?
questions.explanation: The RDA of vitamin A for infants is 350 mcg.

questions.question: What is the dosage of vitamin A given for a 2-year-old baby with keratomalacia?

options.A: 200,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 24 hours
options.B: 100,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 1 week
options.C: 100,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 24 hours and after a week
options.D: 200,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.explanation: The recommended vitamin A dosage for a 2-year-old child with keratomalacia is 200,000 IU given immediately, followed by the same age-specific dose 24 hours later and after 1 week.

questions.question: The dose of iodine for lactating women in India according to the recommended dietary allowance is:
questions.explanation: According to the National Institute of Nutrition (NIN) 2020 guidelines, the recommended dietary allowance (RDA) for dietary iodine in lactating women in India is 280 μg/day. NIN guidelines on recommended dietary allowance for iodine per day: Note: According to the WHO guidelines, the RDA during both pregnancy and lactation is 250 mcg. Age: Male/Female: Birth to 6 months: 100 mcg/100 mcg, 7-12 months: 130 mcg/130 mcg, 1-9 years: 90-120 mcg/90-120 mcg, 10-12 years: 150 mcg/150 mcg, 14-18 years: 150 mcg/150 mcg, > 19 years: 150 mcg/150 mcg, Pregnancy: 250 mcg, Lactation: 280 mcg

questions.question: Which of the following is incorrect regarding the epidemiological assessment of iodinedeficiency?

options.A: Median urinary iodine excretion <200 µg/L indicates insufficient iodine intake
options.B: Neonatal hypothyroidism is a sensitive indicator of environmental iodine deficiency
options.C: Serum T4 level is a more sensitive indicator of thyroid insufficiency than T3
options.D: Quality control of salt is performed by rapid testing with MBI kit

questions.explanation: Median urinary iodine excretion level < 100 µg/L (in non-pregnant population)indicates insufficient iodine intake.Urinary excretion of iodine is used by the WHO for surveillance and epidemiological studies toclassify countries according to the level of iodine deficiency. It is an effective indicator of nationalprogrammes against iodine deficiency.Neonatal hypothyroidism is a sensitive indicator of environmental iodine deficiency. It is also aneffective indicator to monitor the impact of a programme. Serum T4 level is a more sensitiveindicator of thyroid insufficiency in the population than T3.Determination of iodine in salt is a part of the quality control of the product. The UNICEF usesMBI kits to rapidly assess the levels of iodine in salt.

questions.question: How much calcium does a premenopausal woman require on a daily basis?
questions.explanation: A premenopausal woman requires 1000 mg calcium on a daily basis.
